description: An inexpensive blade, available wherever swords are sold. When a swordsman in training takes that all-important first swing, they're usually holding one of these.
A dagger designed to look like a pen. It may not be mightier than the sword, but it's a lot easier to conceal.
A wooden weapon made to protect the fists. The design, though simple, does reduce some of the impact on the joints.
A stock-standard wooden bow, favored by hunters. With its excellent power and range, it's perfect for bagging all kinds of game.
A spear often wielded by soldiers. Its ease of use and long reach make it a popular choice on the battlefield.
A small axe held in one hand. Originally made for throwing, it has proven so easy to wield that it is often used in melee combat.
A staff made from the wood of the Astraean cypress, a fragrant tree that grows in the Mysterion Woods. Its scent helps calm the wounded.
Originally an apron for craftsmen, as evidenced by the large front pocket. Fledgling adventurers use this extra storage space to carry lots of gear.
A favored first choice of adventurers. The name is meant to instill luck to all those making that first foray into the world.
A shield made from a coniferous tree known as the Astraean Cedar. Cheap and easily made, they are a common sight among warriors-in-training.
A standard item that is loved by not only adventurers. Light and easy to walk in. The longer you wear them the more comfortable they become.
Originally a hat worn by painters. Because it's handy against the sun and wind, it's a popular item for novice adventurers.
A mysterious bracelet that energizes the wearer. Increases attack.
An amulet featuring a four-leaf clover. It is said that it brings good luck and protection to the person who wears it.
A bracelet with magical power. When worn, it raises your spirits and increases magic attack.
An unusual sword with a blade and handle connected by gears. A weapon created by a watchmaker and a blacksmith.
A replica of a great sword presented to a certain noble. Not only is it beautiful, it is sharp and practical.
A beautiful sword that glows in the colors of the northern lights. The blade emits light every time it is wielded, and in its wake the light appears to dance.
A beautifully curved sword. It's such a fine blade that a brave and well-known general once said that it would be a shame for it to be sullied by blood.
A knife that is more useful in the forest or mountains rather than in battle. Various gimmicks for survival are packed within it.
Leather gloves embedded with metal that make punches hit harder. Designed for martial artists who strive to make their body a true weapon.
A bow made using materials gathered from the Crystal Mountains. The crystals act as a magical catalyst, enabling it to fire enchanted arrows.
A polearm named after the weapon of the sea-god Poseidon, which held the power to sink continents beneath the waves.
A spear imbued with the strength of a fire spirit. The more monsters it slays, the more fiercely its flame-shaped head blazes.
A steel battle axe. Unlike its cousins made for chopping wood, this axe was intended to be a weapon and is thus quite lethal.
A battle axe crafted using advanced metalworking techniques. Decimates foes with attacks that make full use of its weight.
A rod made by elves, a folk with strong ties to nature. Used both as a weapon and as an implement in prayers for plentifulness.
A cane topped by a dragon clutching an orb. Imbued with faint traces of draconic might.
A staff that facilitates the casting of recovery spells. A favorite of magical healers.
A staff made with the precious horn of a unicorn. The horn has restorative powers and enhances healing magic.
Robes once worn by a priest traveling the continent to spread his faith. Beloved by spellcasters for being hardy while allowing ease of movement.
Armor made from thin plates. Light and nimble, it's characterized by reliable defense and ease of movement.
Armor made of leather and metal arranged like scales. Easy to move around in and strong against slashes or thrusts, but weak against blows from blunt weapons.
Solid armor made with advanced casting techniques. The wearer becomes immune to ordinary attacks.
Clothes that have been woven with a legendary Astraean pattern. You need the proper status and pedigree to purchase it.
There is no better attire for working in the dark. It is said that in some countries, professional spies use it habitually.
A lovely robe reminiscent of spring. The robe is very durable and suitable for travel. Its design and practicality make it a favorite among many people.
A favorite item in the cold, northern countries. The warm yarn is spun from sheep's wool, and the cape weaved from it protects the shoulders and arms from the severe climate.
A metal shield as big as a person's body. It provides overwhelming protection, but is difficult to move with because of its weight.
These stylish boots are inspired by a clown. When you wear them, you will feel happy and cheerful.
Boots made with the bones of monsters that inhabit the high mountains. Its wild design will awaken the wild heart within!
Footwear worn by magic-users during travels to collect potion ingredients. Built sturdily enough to withstand even the harshest of environments.
A casquette with goggles attached. It has a cute, balloon-like silhouette and is all the rage with Landosol's teens.
A helmet used by ancient warriors. It is so sturdy that it can still be used in the modern age.
A hood used by nuns. They say that these nuns have healed not only the bodies, but also the spirits, of injured people.
An orb that grants valor, one of the three key attributes of a warrior. Provides the courage to face any foe in battle without fear.
A strength-enhancing bracelet adorned with the spiked scales of a monster. The viciousness of that beast makes it a rarity out on the market.
An orb that grants virtue, one of the three key attributes of a warrior. Instills a compassionate heart that strives to protect oneself and others.
A bracelet for knights woven with prayers of a safe return home. These wishes keep the wearer safe by boosting defensive abilities.
Special glasses made from ensorceled stone that heighten the wearer's magic attack power.
An orb that grants wisdom, one of the three key attributes of a warrior. Improves spellcasting by clearing the mind and granting intelligence.
A monocle used by a noble wizard. Runes are engraved on the metal frame, raising the magic power of the wearer.
A silver bracelet decorated with magic stones and special engravings. It revitalizes the flow of magic and increases the magic power of the wearer.
A curved blade made of meteorite shards. The blade shines like stardust when bathed in light.
A sword emblazoned with the fiery breath of a dragon. Its wide blade is better for slashing than thrusting, and its wielder will look like a dragon beautifully in motion.
A wizard used this blade specifically for close combat. Since he was physically weak, he enchanted the feathers of a large bird and used them to create this extremely light sword.
A sword granted to those licensed in a sword style taught in an eastern kingdom. It contains moonlight and heightens the wielder's five senses along with their sixth sense.
It is said that a powerful samurai defeated a thunder beast with this sword. This sword is imbued with the power of lightning.
A dagger made from very expensive platinum. Many aristocrats keep one at their side for self-defense.
A fearsome dagger with its own will and a constant thirst for blood. When bathed in blood, rather than rusting, it shines even more bewitchingly.
A claw in the shape of the jaws of a vicious black dragon. It enables the wearer to see in the dark. An assassin who once used this claw soaked it in poison to increase its lethality.
A man once gifted his sweetheart the game he took down with this bow. In tribute, he named the bow after the god of love.
A bow made by demons persecuted by people and driven deep underground. They have defeated many humans entering their territory with this bow.
A halberd given to a prestigious knight. Its unbreakable blade represents the pride of a knight fighting for his country and people.
A spear that can kill with a single blow. Its deadly power easily penetrates even the strongest armor, stopping the enemy's breath with a single thrust.
A battle axe with a blue, astronomical object. The astronomical object symbolizes the world itself and absorbs the energy of the earth to imbue the wearer with power.
Every time this axe decorated with brilliant flowers is wielded, a large, new ring of fresh blood blooms.
An axe made in a workshop specializing in advanced weapon manufacturing. It is possible to store lightning inside the axe and release it when attacking.
A staff used by a group of brutal wizards. This staff has been dyed red with the blood of its victims.
A wizard is said to have obtained this item through a deal with a devil. The souls of its victims are believed to be offered to the devil.
A staff used by a clan of wizards who are astrologers by trade. They observe the stars and predict the future.
The desire to save others causes these buds to bloom. Their untainted energy is the source of their healing power.
Armor made with a strong and fashionable knight in mind. However, no matter how fashionable one may be, without actual strength, one's charm will be severely reduced.

The armor of a female warrior who defeated a series of strong men and became queen of the arena. It is said that one look into her beastly eyes will cause her opponents in the battlefield to lose their will to fight.
Armor made of thick steel plates. Forgoing lightness, it specializes in defense, and is favored by warriors who use axes and swords.
A knight with a penchant for flamboyance had this armor made for him. His bravado caused him to stand out on the battlefield, attracting enemies to his location.
A piece of clothing consisting of a leather robe over fabric. It provides excellent protection against the cold and is suitable for gathering materials in cold weather.
A noble dress for a female knight of the royal castle. The dress is made of fine leather and black gold, and the chest adorned with a symbol indicating the status of a knight.
The clothes worn by the Elven Queen during peace treaty meetings with other races. Elvenfolk endowed it with a powerful magic veil just in case.
This robe is modeled on a garment worn by the god of love. With feathers that float magically on its back, the robe is often mistaken for the real thing.
The robes of a philosopher who supported a child emperor. He taught the boy the right path and principles, leading the country to a better future.
The shield of a brave and courageous general. From the battle's front line, he personally cut into the enemy's territory and led the army to victory.
Special boots that make footsteps silent. Rumors say Eastern spies wore such boots, but they remain a mystery.
Boots made for swordsmen who use rapiers and other slender swords. They are very light, perfect for those who seek mobility over strength.
A mage's formal boots. They are enchanted so they never get dirty, no matter where they go.
A helmet used by knights who worship the now deceased black dragon. They continued to take the lives of innocent people as sacrifices for the dragon.
A headband that a wizard's family gives to a daughter leaving the home for training. The mother kneads in her own magical power, creating it with love.
A traditional mage's hat adorned with accessories that impove their magic.
Magical opal earrings. The wearer's body will overflow with vitality and attack power will increase.
A headdress made from feathers of a Gryphon, a creature with the head and wings of an eagle and the body of a lion. The power of a ferocious beast dwells within it.
A rare scarlet diamond. It is said to contain the flames of a dragon. By equipping it, one will gain power like that of a raging fire.
Magical emerald earrings. The wearer gains an indomitable spirit and increased defense.
An eight-pointed star that represents infinite circulation. It absorbs eight naturally occurring elements to endow the wearer with continuous protection.
Once owned by a king known as Lionheart. Having spent most of his life in battle, many people revered him for his bravery.
Magical turquoise earrings. The wearer gains wisdom and increased magical attack power.
Magical pearl earrings. The wearer gains better mental concentration and magical power.
Wise men use this in Grotto Quests for energy flows. The energy flowing through the ground is studied and used to investigate the conditions of the environment and continent.
It is said that after the spirit Daphne transformed herself into a laurel tree, Apollo, who loved her, wore a leaf from her tree as a sign of his eternal love.
Once wielded by a powerful archangel, this brilliant silver blade contains the power that banishes all evil with a single swing.
A sword said to be blessed by the sun god Apollo. The person who wielded this sword was called the Sun King. He made history and brought prosperity to the realm for many years.
A sword that sleeps deep in the ruins of the forest. The person chosen by this sword can reach its location upon being invited by a butterfly.
A sword of light crafted over a lifetime by a swordsmith who received a vision from the Goddess of Light, Aglaia. The sword was in the possession of a brave man who used it to oppose the Demon God.
A dagger said to have been given to the king of the humans by a dwarf master craftsman. The material used to make it is unknown and unlike any existing ore.
A royal heirloom dagger in the oldest kingdom in history. The sword was handed down to princesses over generations, bestowing them with magic to protect their country.
A crimson gauntlet forged in the flames of purgatory. The flames emanating from the gauntlet burn enemies into oblivion.
A golden gauntlet used by a famous king called Lionheart. It is said that the gauntlet gives its wearer unlimited power and the promise of becoming a fierce warrior.
A hero imbued the power of lightning into his bow to slay a man-eating sea dragon. The arrows infused with the power of lightning are said to have felled the sea dragon in a single blow.
A great bow used by an Archangel in the apocalyptic war against the devil in a bygone era. It is said that the force of the arrows from this bow reached Cocytus, the Ninth Circle of Hell.
A spear that was thrust into the back of a dragon living in a volcano. Since the tip of the spear was in the body of the dragon for many years, it now bears the power of fire.
A large spear used by a legendary queen who ruled the entire continent. She was both wise and adept at fighting, using this spear to seize the continent.
Evil dragons that threatened the world of mankind were sealed in this axe by heroes of every region. The axe, in which the spirits of the dragons reside, emits evil energy.
A double-edged axe that contains hellfire. Its body is red like blood; a single swing will douse the enemy in crimson flames, burning them down to their bones.
The staff belonged to a wizard who became a vengeful demon after his wife was murdered. He caged his own anger in this staff and killed everyone involved in his wife's murder.
A mysterious staff that is said to have been made by ancient sages using sun shards. It is said that whoever this staff chooses will be granted omniscience and omnipotence.

This staff is said to have been used by the goddess of the moon to cure the illnesses of her faithful followers. Fearing her power, the god of death is said to have hidden the wand in the netherworlds.
A miracle staff made of giant branches from the Tree of Life. It is said that if you shake it, fresh, green leaves will sprout on a dead tree and water will spring forth from the ground.
Enchanted armor that makes one invisible. A princess of a certain country once fell in love with someone she couldn't be with, so she used this armor to run away.
Supreme armor featuring a rare metal that has the brilliance of silver with a strength that surpasses steel, as well as beauty and toughness born from a master craftsman.
Armor used by angels in battle. Lower-level demons cannot even approach this armor as the light reflecting from its silver alone is enough to disintegrate them.
Armor imbued with the soul of a berserker who devoted himself to battle. Whoever wears this armor gains the power of a war demon.
A priest, ordered by the king in secret, risked his life to create this beautiful vestment. Since the garment was sewn in the light of the moon, it glows in seven different colors when in moonlight.
The clothes of a hermit who peeked into the magic abyss. It was sewn with threads enchanted with magic power.
A robe worn by a great mage who devoted his entire lifetime to magic. Due to this mage's mighty power, these robes still emit mysterious energies.
Robes worn by saints who confronted demons alongside angels. Their gallantry in battle became the stuff of legends.
A shield given only to the Queen's guards, in whom she places her absolute trust. It holds the power of absolute protection, even reflecting magic and curses.
Armor blessed with holy power, used by paladins who risk their lives to protect the people from monsters.
The sacred boots of a mythical creature. It allows the wearer to walk cooly through flames and ward off all attacks.
A special pair of boots given only to wizards recognized by the crown. Only an elder elf artisan can make such an item.
A helmet used by a demigod knight called the Sky Dancer. It is said that he would dance freely in the sky and toss his enemies in the air.
Proof one has attained the highest level of magic recognized by the state.\nThose who possess this hood\nare allowed to stand beside the king.
A hood worn by successive religious leaders during diplomatic affairs. It grants the wearer powers of exorcism and the ability to see through illusions.
This special ore combines and encapsulates the magic of the four great spirits. It is the greatest creation of an extraordinary alchemist.
A legendary magic tool created by a long reigning emperor. It is said to help its wearer by bearing whatever misfortunes fall upon them.
An amulet of the moon goddess, whose loved one was harmed by an arrow. The magic of the waning moon repels flying arrows.
